content.full_text: Bank Draft of Stephen A. Douglas to Abraham Lincoln, 21 December 18471 Pay to HonA Lincolnor order one hundred & sixty seven dollars & charge the same to my account.2
paragraphs: Bank Draft of Stephen A. Douglas to Abraham Lincoln, 21 December 18471 Pay to HonA Lincolnor order one hundred & sixty seven dollars & charge the same to my account.2
citations: Abraham Lincoln to Richard Yates;Lincoln collected debt for St. Louis Perpetual Insurance Co., Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=141520.

footnotes.text:
1Stephen A. Douglas wrote and signed the bank draft. Abraham Lincoln endorsed the draft
                  on the second page.

2Douglas owed theSt. Louis Perpetual Insurance Company$337.49. Lincoln collected this part of the debt on behalf ofRichard Yates, who was likely engaged as an attorney for the company.Abraham Lincoln to Richard Yates;Lincoln collected debt for St. Louis Perpetual Insurance Co., Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=141520.
